ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Chains and slowdown
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Sounds like you win a cookie.  :) Since you re L37, why don t you test Chain s slowdown for us at L38 and L39?  Just got to a newbie area, find an area
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 9 Mar 2000, Eric Boller wrote:
>
> Renbre stated that he noticed that level 39 was the
> first level where he could get the mob to stop using
> chain/fear when the mob was at half health...Prior to
> that he was not able to stop the mob at half health (I
> have never been able to yet myself). So I'm wondering
> if the boost in affect of chains occurs at level 39 or
> so in both attack slowdown and movement slowdown.
>
> Thex Luteslinger (Tunare)
> 37th level bard

Sounds like you win a cookie. :)

Since you're L37, why don't you test Chain's slowdown for us
at L38 and L39? Just got to a newbie area, find an area away
from other combat spam, repeatedly Chain a mob, and time how
long it takes for it to attack you 10 times (the attack when
you start your stopwatch is #0, not #1). If it's 39 seconds,
then it's the 30% I observed between L23 and L35. If it's
42-43 sec, then you're getting the 40% I'm getting at L48.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
